intro: Epilobium chilense f. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf willow herb, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its lanceolate to broadly elliptic leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and forest understories. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
